For 2023+ I extended my goal to $10m. Currently sitting at $2.3m realized

In a year from now, people will call us extremely lucky again.

How to get rich in crypto with no money:

1) Post on Twitter
2) Farm Airdrops and document
3) Pick up an intern job and save
4) Re-invest in your farm and buy low caps

The new class of crypto bros don't know how easy they have it now. Back then, we didn't have this luxury.

Y'all are aping because theres only 1k btc in confirmed Grayscale transactions.

Don't forget btc is slow as fuck and there might be pending transactions in the mempool.

If your thesis works out, but you were too early to the play, were you even right?

For example, I bet the ETF approval or the latest launch will be a sell the news event.

I sold before before Christmas, expecting a potential approval before the holiday season.

How to have highly profitable trades:

Take highly profitable setups only.

Sounds too simple. Maybe even stupid. But take a moment and think about how many shitty trades you enter on a daily basis. 

Many of us would be more profitable by simply doing less.

If this is your first cycle:

Set a $ goal and make list of what you gonna do with the money.

Once you hit it, get out and do exactly what you planned to do.

You are not a genius investor/trader. You just got lucky and most likely will give it all back. Almost all of us did.

Do what most people don‚Äôt.

Explore new chains and airdrops to interact with. Post your ideas online. Discover patterns and dig for inefficiencies.

The more you do these things, the luckier you will get.

One of the easiest things you can do in an uptrending market is to have a bunch of resting bids at optimistic key levels.

The flushes will always come. While others ape and chase, I prefer to drink some tea and wait for the inevitable fill to happen, then sell shortly after. https://t.co/FcHhDN7LKF

I‚Äôve been holding mostly majors on spot. Looking to get back more into the lower caps to place some bull market bets.

Shill me all your coins that you would hold for at least one year from now and why.

I‚Äôll go through all of them and buy your bags if it‚Äôs something good.

If you keep doing the same things you've been doing, you‚Äôll get the same results as the years before.

The way you take this statement depends on how well you‚Äôve been doing.

Being lucky or running hot whenever you get started in crypto makes such a big difference.

I often think about the people who joined at the top or during peak bear, got absolutely raped, and never returned.

If you start winning immediately, you build massive confidence. The‚Ä¶

Serious question:

Did you outperform Bitcoin this year?

I didn't. Crazy to imagine I could've chilled in a single spot position all year and done better than trading all year.

Don't get me wrong. Trading did very well, but not as well as a 2.5x without much effort and stress. https://t.co/yhuqKOLNQW

Important to add:

Expand your timeframe of how long you will hold these entries. Do not sell for minimal gains. Do not sell everything until one or two years in.

Taking profits on Futures is fine, but I make sure to convert some of the positions into spot bags and let them run.‚Ä¶

Although price action has been dull in the past week, I have little reason to be bearish throughout the next month.

I have been mainly sitting on my hands in a few selected positions and am waiting for the fomo to kick in again.

All it takes is a little bit of patience.

What I love about trading is that it can pay extremely well with little to no costs involved.

What I hate about it is that it still requires you to trade your time for money.

Everyone making fun of wagies doesn't understand that they are wagies with golden handcuffs themself.
